t: Lamentations 3
Great Is Your Faithfulness
I*pn am the man who has seen affliction under*ld the rod of his wrath;
he*ln has driven and brought me into*ld darkness without any light;
surely*ln against me he turns his hand again*ld and again the whole day long.
He*pn has made my flesh and my skin waste away; he*ld has broken my bones;
he*ln has besieged and enveloped me with*ld bitterness and tribulation;
he*ln has made me dwell in darkness like*ld the dead of long ago.
He*pn has walled me about so that I cannot escape; he*ld has made my chains heavy;
though*ln I call and cry for help, he*ld shuts out my prayer;
he*ln has blocked my ways with blocks of stones; he*ld has made my paths crooked.
He*pn is a bear lying in wait for me, a*ld lion in hiding;
he*ln turned aside my steps and tore me to pieces; he*ld has made me desolate;
he*ln bent his bow and set me as*ld a target for his arrow.
He*pn drove into my kidneys the*ld arrows of his quiver;
I*ln have become the laughingstock of all peoples, the*ld object of their taunts all day long.
He*ln has filled me with bitterness; he*ld has sated me with wormwood.
He*pn has made my teeth grind on gravel, and*ld made me cower in ashes;
my*ln soul is bereft of peace; I*ld have forgotten what happiness is;
so*ln I say, “My endurance has perished; so*ld has my hope from the Lord.”*s
Remember*pn my affliction and my wanderings, the*ld wormwood and the gall!
My*ln soul continually remembers it and*ld is bowed down within me.
But*ln this I call to mind, and*ld therefore I have hope:
The*pn steadfast love of the Lord*s never ceases; his*ld mercies never come to an end;
they*ln are new every morning; great*ld is your faithfulness.
“The*ln Lord*s is my portion,” says my soul, “therefore*ld I will hope in him.”
The*pn Lord*s is good to those who wait for him, to*ld the soul who seeks him.
It*ln is good that one should wait quietly for*ld the salvation of the Lord.*s
It*ln is good for a man that he bear the*ld yoke in his youth.
Let*pn him sit alone in silence when*ld it is laid on him;
let*ln him put his mouth in the dust— there*ld may yet be hope;
let*ln him give his cheek to the one who strikes, and*ld let him be filled with insults.
For*pn the Lord will not cast*ld off forever,
but,*ln though he cause grief, he will have compassion according*ld to the abundance of his steadfast love;
for*ln he does not afflict from his heart or*ld grieve the children of men.
To*pn crush underfoot all*ld the prisoners of the earth,
to*ln deny a man justice in*ld the presence of the Most High,
to*ln subvert a man in his lawsuit, the*ld Lord does not approve.
Who*pn has spoken and it came to pass, unless*ld the Lord has commanded it?
Is*ln it not from the mouth of the Most High that*ld good and bad come?
Why*ln should a living man complain, a*ld man, about the punishment of his sins?
Let*pn us test and examine our ways, and*ld return to the Lord!*s
Let*ln us lift up our hearts and hands to*ld God in heaven:
“We*ln have transgressed and rebelled, and*ld you have not forgiven.
“You*pn have wrapped yourself with anger and pursued us, killing*ld without pity;
you*ln have wrapped yourself with a cloud so*ld that no prayer can pass through.
You*ln have made us scum and garbage among*ld the peoples.
“All*pn our enemies open*ld their mouths against us;
panic*ln and pitfall have come upon us, devastation*ld and destruction;
my*ln eyes flow with rivers of tears because*ld of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
“My*pn eyes will flow without ceasing, without*ld respite,
until*ln the Lord*s from heaven looks*ld down and sees;
my*ln eyes cause me grief at*ld the fate of all the daughters of my city.
“I*pn have been hunted like a bird by*ld those who were my enemies without cause;
they*ln flung me alive into the pit and*ld cast stones on me;
water*ln closed over my head; I*ld said, ‘I am lost.’
“I*pn called on your name, O Lord,*s from*ld the depths of the pit;
you*ln heard my plea, ‘Do not close your*ld ear to my cry for help!’
You*ln came near when I called on you; you*ld said, ‘Do not fear!’
“You*pn have taken up my cause, O Lord; you*ld have redeemed my life.
You*ln have seen the wrong done to me, O Lord;*s judge*ld my cause.
You*ln have seen all their vengeance, all*ld their plots against me.
“You*pn have heard their taunts, O Lord,*s all*ld their plots against me.
The*ln lips and thoughts of my assailants are*ld against me all the day long.
Behold*ln their sitting and their rising; I*ld am the object of their taunts.
“You*pn will repay them, O Lord,*s according*ld to the work of their hands.
You*ln will give them dullness of heart; your*ld curse will be on them.
You*ln will pursue them in anger and destroy them from*ld under your heavens, O Lord.”*s
